attributes.comment:
Dear Mr. Chertoff, I strongly oppose your intention to raise the CIS fees because
the fee hike is too severe and will prohibit many worthy persons from applying for
benefits. This fee hike will force immigrants who have various family members that
simultaneously qualify for benefits not to be able to file together because these
fees are so exorbitant. Many immigrants are scammed by notarios and this fee
hike will add to the financial loss they suffer when they discover they were ripped
off by the notario, lost a lot of money in CIS fees, and possibly face deportation. If
CIS is fee based, how does it plan on surviving if filings significantly drop off
because immigrants can't afford the fees ? A reasonable fee hike is
understandable but doubling or tripling the fees is unreasonable and severe and I
hope you reconsider. Thank you. Elizabeth M. Mendoza Macias P.S. One last
thing, how about the U.S. government deduct $1,000 from the foreign aid we give a
country for each national of theirs we deport ? That money could be dedicated to
CIS to process applications for immigrants here who don't engage in behavior that
provokes their deportation.
attributes.title: Comment Submitted By Elizabeth M. Mendoza Macias
